Song.title: How Great Thou Art
Song.copyright: Stuart K. Kline, Arrangement by Paul Baloche

Arrangement.text:
VERSE 1: O Lord my [C]God! When I in [F]awesome wonder Consider [C]all the [G]worlds Thy [F]hands have [C]made. I see the [C]stars, I hear the [F]rolling thunder, Thy power through-[C]out the [G]uni[F]verse [C]displayed.
CHORUS: Then sings my [C]soul, my [F]Savior God, to [C]Thee; How great Thou [G]art,[Gsus][F]how great Thou [C]art! Then sings my [C]soul, My [F]Savior God, to [C]Thee: How great Thou [G]art,[F]how great Thou [C]art![Csus][C][Csus]
VERSE 2: When through the [C]woods, and forest [F]glades I wander And hear the [C]birds sing [G]sweetly [F]in the [C]trees, When I look [C]down from lofty [F]mountain grandeur, And hear the [C]brook, and [G]feel the [F]gentle [C]breeze;
VERSE 3: And when I [C]think that God, His [F]Son not sparing, Sent Him to [C]die, I [G]scarce can [F]take it [C]in; That on the [C]cross, my burden [F]gladly bearing, He bled and [C]died to [G]take [F]away my [C]sin:
VERSE 4: When Christ shall [C]come with shout of [F]acclamation And take me [C]home, what [G]joy shall [F]fill my [C]heart! Then I shall [C]bow in humble [F]adoration, And there [C]proclaim, my [G]God. how [F]great Thou [C]art!
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 o lord my god when i in awesome wonder consider all the worlds thy hands have made i see the stars i hear the rolling thunder thy power throughout the universe displayed chorus then sings my soul my savior god to thee how great thou arthow great thou art then sings my soul my savior god to thee how great thou arthow great thou art verse 2 when through the woods and forest glades i wander and hear the birds sing sweetly in the trees when i look down from lofty mountain grandeur and hear the brook and feel the gentle breeze verse 3 and when i think that god his son not sparing sent him to die i scarce can take it in that on the cross my burden gladly bearing he bled and died to take away my sin verse 4 when christ shall come with shout of acclamation and take me home what joy shall fill my heart then i shall bow in humble adoration and there proclaim my god how great thou art

Arrangement.text:
VERSE 1: O [F/G]Lord my [C]God! When [C/E]I in [F]awesome wonder [F/D] Consider [C]all the [G]worlds Thy [G7]hands have [C]made. I [F/G]see the [C]stars, I [C/E]hear the [F]rolling thunder, [F/D] Thy power through-[C]out the [G]uni[G7]verse [C]displayed.
CHORUS: Then [F/G]sings my [C]soul, my [F]Savior [F/D]God, to [C]Thee; How great Thou [G]art,[Gsus][G7]how great Thou [C]art! Then [F/G]sings my [C]soul, My [F]Savior [F/D]God, to [C]Thee: How [G/B]great [C/A]Thou [G]art,[Dm/F]how [G7]great Thou [C]art![Csus][C][Csus]
VERSE 2: When [F/G]through the [C]woods, and [C/E]forest [F]glades I wander [F/D] And hear the [C]birds sing [G]sweetly [G7]in the [C]trees, When [F/G]I look [C]down from [C/E]lofty [F]mountain grandeur, [F/D] And hear the [C]brook, and [G]feel the [G7]gentle [C]breeze;
VERSE 3: And [F/G]when I [C]think that [C/E]God, His [F]Son not sparing, [F/D] Sent Him to [C]die, I [G]scarce can [G7]take it [C]in; That [F/G]on the [C]cross, my [C/E]burden [F]gladly bearing, [F/D] He bled and [C]died to [G]take [G7]away my [C]sin:
VERSE 4: When [F/G]Christ shall [C]come with [C/E]shout of [F]acclamation [F/D] And take me [C]home, what [G]joy shall [G7]fill my [C]heart! Then [F/G]I shall [C]bow in [C/E]humble [F]adoration, [F/D] And there [C]proclaim, my [G]God. how [G7]great Thou [C]art!
